e. All exposed stairs and upper-level walkways shall be pro-
vided with snow melting equipment.

2. The Developer shall design his building so as to provide the
maximum feasible amount of space for retailing, retail services
and related commercial activities fronting on the second level

-y walkway. .
»

3. The Developer shall build and maintain sidewalks along Balti-
more Street in @ minimum width of 15' and along Hopkins Place
in widths varying from a minimum of 17' to 23.5' as shown on
Exhibit entitled, Site Definition, page 10. The surface treat-
ment shall be in conformance with the standard Charles Center-
sidewalk specifications (a washed or sandblasted finish with,
exposed limestone aggregate). -



4. The Developer shall build and maintain the ingress ramp and
tunnel in area '""C'" and the egress ramp and tunnel in area "G"
in a minimum curb-to-curb width of 10'with minimum curbs of
18" width (13' minimum distance, wall-to-wall). During con-
struction, the Developer must protect any and all utilities in
and adjacent to the areas of the ramps and tunnels.

5

5. The open portions of the egress and ingress ramp shall not ex-
ceed that shown on Exhibit entitled Site Definition, page 10.



6. All signs contemplated by the Developer shall conform to the
document, '"Charles Center Sign Procedure and Guidelines, '
pages 26 and 27 herein.

; 7. All construction within the Property will be the responsibility
of the Developer.

8. If the AIR RIGHTS, area ""A'", are used, the Developer shall
provide, at his cost, soffit lighting with necessary conduits,
over the sidewalk, in accordance with Charles Center Standards.
The conduit may be attached to a City service, however.

E. PEDESTRIAN AND VEHICULAR ACCESS

Pedestrian access is available along the entire west and north pro-
perty lines at sidewalk elevations of Hopkins Place and Baltimore Street
and from the Public Park on the south and east at approximate El. 44'. In
addition, access is available along the entire length of the upper-level walk-
way (approximate El. 59'), which will connect on the west to the Civic
Center and on the east and north to the legitimate theater, the new hotel
and the rest of Charles Center extending north to Saratoga Street.

Vehicular access will be solely through ramps and tunnels in Hopkins
Place, as shown on Exhibit entitled, Site Definition, page 10. No vehicular
access will be permitted from or to Baltimore Street.



13
